content: I've been experimenting with flash photography, and I did try using my 50mm f/1.8 prime lens with the external flash unit I got on March 28th. The results were promising, but I still need to refine my technique. I found that the flash helped to add depth and dimension to my images, especially when using the lens at its widest aperture. However, I need to work on balancing the flash output with the ambient light to avoid overexposure. Do you have any tips on how to achieve a more natural-looking balance between flash and ambient light?
